snippet: Amnesty International said the government had flattened entire neighborhoods with banned weapons, but the agency also found an escalation of abuses by the opposition.
abstract: Amnesty International issues report detailing what it calls war crimes committed by both sides in Syria's ongoing civil war; cites wholesale destruction of neighborhoods with banned weapons by government forces, as well as escalation of abuses by opposition.
lead_paragraph: Amnesty International said the government had flattened entire neighborhoods with banned weapons, but the agency also found an escalation of abuses by the opposition.
